beer.beer_description:
Skull Splitter has a rich fruity wine-like complexity. Flavours include fresh and dried fruits; warm exotic spice and mellow summer fruity notes.  

Sophisticated, satiny smooth and full flavoured beer. It is one of our strongest beers, named after Thorfinn Einarsson the 7th Viking Earl of Orkney. 

Pair with fruit puddings and or rich dark meats such as venison or alternatively, Skullsplitter is a delight as a digestif.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 50 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 11!

items.checkin_comment: Toasted malt. Also smoky like scotch whiskey

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 35 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 8!
Travel much? You must be a "brewsetter". That's at least 5 beers from 5 different countries.

Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 35 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 8!

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 225 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 46!

Whether it's a Scotch Ale, Scottish Ale, or a traditional Wee Heavy, don your kilt and prepare yourself for a wee bit of Scotch. That's 10 different beers with style of Scotch Ale / Wee Heavy or Scottish Ale. Try 5 more for Level 3!

items.checkin_comment: Burnt copper colored. Sweet malt and apple cider nose.   Lots of apple juice on palate bready malts and a hit of bitter. Not what I would call a wee heavy or scotch ale at all.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 285 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 58!

items.checkin_comment: Burnt copper colored. Nose of sweet malt, apple cider, and bread.  Lots of apple juice on the tongue.  Not complex.  No strength behind it for abv.  Best room temp where more date fruit flavor comes and alcohol strength.

items.badge_description: It's time to give bottle shops some love by adding them as your purchased location. That's 345 check-ins with a purchased location! Tag 5 more to get to Level 70. Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 250 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 51!

items.checkin_comment: Difficult to rate. I got this to pair with Christmas cake and the pairing was 👌🏻. On its own this might be a 3.75, but I think I have to give it a 4.5 in this situation.

items.checkin_comment: Day Twenty. Wow! Time flying. Always love these Wee Heavy’s. Hope you’re still awake Jeff G.

items.comment: Awake…. I was thinking about running 21 in about 43 minutes.

items.badge_description: Thanks for staying at home, and checking in with Untappd! It allows us to stay connected to a community of beer lovers, just like you, even if we can't be in the same physical location. From our home to yours, cheers and stay safe!

It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That's 415 check-ins with a photo.  Try 5 more for Level 84!

items.checkin_comment: This smells like a booze bomb. Tastes bitter from the outset. Theres a touch of cherry in here and a little bit of some kind of christmas cake. Its a little unsatisfying overall. Bottle from the health food shop in lebanon.

user.bio: Mostly on Ratebeer as solidfunk. Also freelance beer stories for Smithsonian Mag, Virginia Craft Beer.

items.checkin_comment: Dark, coppery, & clear w/a malty-sweet aroma. Crisp & malty palate balanced by lingering bitterness. Gets my Highlander-Viking blood going. Makes me want to swing an axe.

user.bio:
BJCP Trained
Beer & Spirits Brand Ambassador
The Marine Corps was founded in a tavern. Just carrying on the tradition!
